revised_title: Earthquakes Felt at Brussels: A Letter from John Pringle, M.D. F.R.S. to Thomas Birch, D.D. F.R.S.
tldr: In a letter to Thomas Birch, Dr. John Pringle reports on three earthquakes experienced in Brussels during the winter of 1755. The shocks alarmed the inhabitants but had no bad consequences. Dr. Pringle also mentions a letter about a river sinking near Pontypool in Wales.
